intro: Ophiorrhiza decipiens, commonly known as the deceptive mistletoe, is a hemiparasitic plant that grows on the branches of various host trees. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae and is characterized by its small, leathery leaves and inconspicuous white flowers. The plant derives some of its nutrients from the host through specialized structures called haustoria, while also performing photosynthesis. It is native to Southeast Asia and is often found in tropical and subtropical regions. Its unique ecological role makes it an interesting subject for botanical study.
